item.title: How Virtual offices can be a hurdle for coworking spaces?
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
The concept of working from virtual offices has become the new normal. The setup is digitized so that one can work from absolutely anywhere while projecting a professional view. This trend challenges the coworking industry in spaces known as “the communal work hubs where people and small businesses come together,” as the dictionary defines them. …

How Virtual offices can be a hurdle for coworking spaces? Read More »

The post How Virtual offices can be a hurdle for coworking spaces? appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
The concept of working from virtual offices has become the new normal. The setup is digitized so that one can work from absolutely anywhere while projecting a professional view. This trend challenges the coworking industry in spaces known as “the communal work hubs where people and small businesses come together,” as the dictionary defines them. Look at how virtual offices are damaging coworking spaces and how they can be mitigated.

The Decline in Membership: Empty Desks and Diminishing Foot Traffic

Many coworking spaces are losing memberships as the pool of virtual offices grows and becomes a rising trend.

People are going contemporary, finding it more comfortable to work from wherever they are and prefer to avoid signing up for a physical office. This leaves many coworking spaces with empty desks, low foot traffic, and non-vibrancy.

Disruption in the Coworking Landscape: Shifting Demands and Expectations

With its members’ changing needs and expectations, coworking spaces still have to align themselves with the new norm of a virtual office. This attractiveness of remote work is forcing rethinking among most people and companies about the need for physical office spaces, and the trend has resulted in falling numbers of members at traditional coworking spaces.

That will make hybrid work models, which meld full-time and part-time remote and in-person collaboration for coworking spaces, all the more confusing.

Competition for Clients: Losing the Battle for Business

Virtual offices have made the competition tough for coworking spaces to attract customers. This has now become a phenomenon that benefits businesses and freelancers not attached to a location. It has increased the scramble of the coworking spaces to keep their existing clientele and draw new faces—a hard business landscape for them.

The strain on Community Dynamics: Fracturing the Sense of Community

The latter form of coworking spaces is driven by community interaction and collaboration in a way that, at times, unfails the virtual offices in their wake. This is so because, with less physical human presence, there is reduced camaraderie and a general sense of purpose, often leaving a gap among the members and diluting the vibrant atmosphere of coworking spaces.

Financial Pressures: Tightening Budgets and Tough Decisions

The virtual office has quite an economic effect on coworking. This must modulate with a dwindling membership at the coworking space and increasing competition, which now leads to an increasing financial heat. This leaves them making hard decisions on strict mechanisms that cut costs and pricing strategies to survive in a hostile market.

Navigating the Virtual Office Storm

It could also test for the opportunity to think innovatively and adaptively in the face of several challenges, such as plummeting membership, financial strains, and community dynamics.

This leaves plenty of room to define the value proposition further, strengthen community relationships, and find new revenue potentials so that coworking spaces can compete with virtual offices head-on and emerge all the better and more durable for it in this ever-evolving modern work environment.

However, virtual offices provide firm challenges, but they also offer opportunities for innovation and adaptation to coworking spaces. This is done through understanding how the dynamic needs of the members can satisfy the improvement of the level of community participation and using technology to improve the service of the workplace.

Ultimately, therefore, coworking spaces can continue to flourish amidst the current thrust in the landscape of modern work by accepting this change while at the same time remaining true to their central values of collaboration and community.

The post How Virtual offices can be a hurdle for coworking spaces? appeared first on Propques.

item.title: How to Obtain a Coworking Franchise in India
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents The Rise of Coworking Spaces and the Potential of a Coworking Franchise Coworking spaces have seen a tremendous rise in popularity in recent years and with good reason. Coworking spaces offer a flexible, affordable and collaborative alternative as the traditional office model becomes less appealing to entrepreneurs, freelancers, and small businesses. The potential of …

How to Obtain a Coworking Franchise in India Read More »

The post How to Obtain a Coworking Franchise in India appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Home » Blog Category » Industry

Table of Contents

The Rise of Coworking Spaces and the Potential of a Coworking Franchise

Coworking spaces have seen a tremendous rise in popularity in recent years and with good reason. Coworking spaces offer a flexible, affordable and collaborative alternative as the traditional office model becomes less appealing to entrepreneurs, freelancers, and small businesses.

The potential of a coworking franchise is undeniable. By tapping into the growing demand for shared workspaces, entrepreneurs can capitalize on this booming industry while benefiting from an established brand and support system.

A coworking franchise provides a turnkey solution for individuals looking to enter the market. With a proven business model and ongoing support from the franchisor, entrepreneurs can focus on building relationships with their members and creating a thriving community within their space.

The benefits of joining a coworking franchise are numerous. Franchisees gain access to comprehensive training programs, marketing support, and operational guidance. This allows them to hit the ground running and quickly establish themselves as leaders in their local market.

Furthermore, being part of a larger network of coworking spaces opens up opportunities for collaboration and cross-promotion. Members can enjoy the flexibility of working from any location within the franchise network, creating a sense of community that extends beyond individual spaces.

In conclusion, as the demand for flexible workspaces continues to grow, investing in a coworking franchise presents an exciting opportunity for entrepreneurs. With its proven success and ongoing support system, this business model allows individuals to tap into the potential of this thriving industry while making a positive impact on their local entrepreneurial ecosystem.

The Benefits of Owning a Coworking Franchise

    • Lucrative Market: Exploring the booming demand for flexible workspaces and how it translates into profitability.

    • Proven Business Model: Highlighting the advantages of investing in an established franchise system with a track record of success.

    • Built-in Community: Discussing how being part of a larger coworking network can attract members and foster collaboration.

    • Simplified Operations: Showcasing how franchisors provide support systems, technology platforms, and operational guidelines to streamline business management.

    • Growth Potential: Exploring the scalability options within the coworking industry and potential for multiple locations or regional expansion.

The Latest Franchise Opportunities in India’s Booming Coworking Sector

India’s coworking sector has experienced tremendous growth in recent years, presenting lucrative franchise opportunities for aspiring entrepreneurs. With the rise of remote work and the increasing demand for flexible office spaces, coworking has become a thriving industry in India.

For those looking to enter the franchise business in India, investing in a coworking franchise can be a smart move. The latest franchise opportunities in India’s booming coworking sector offer a chance to tap into this rapidly expanding market and capitalize on its potential.

By becoming a franchisee, you can leverage an established brand, proven business model, and ongoing support from the franchisor. This significantly reduces the risks associated with starting a new venture from scratch.

The beauty of coworking franchises lies in their ability to provide turnkey solutions for entrepreneurs and professionals seeking flexible workspace solutions. These franchises typically offer fully furnished offices, shared amenities, networking opportunities, and additional services such as meeting rooms and virtual office facilities.

Moreover, as more companies embrace remote work policies and seek cost-effective alternatives to traditional office spaces, the demand for coworking spaces is only expected to grow further. This presents an excellent opportunity for franchisees to capitalize on this trend and establish themselves as key players in the Indian coworking landscape.

Whether you are an experienced entrepreneur or someone looking to venture into business ownership for the first time, exploring the latest franchise opportunities in India’s booming coworking sector can be a game-changer. With proper due diligence and strategic planning, you can position yourself at the forefront of this thriving industry while reaping substantial financial rewards.

Don’t miss out on this exciting chance to be part of India’s flourishing coworking ecosystem. Invest in a well-established coworking franchise today and embark on your journey toward entrepreneurial success!

Selecting the Right Coworking Franchise: Key Considerations for Success

    1. Finding a Reputable Franchisor: Discusses the importance of researching franchisors’ track records, brand reputation, and support systems.

    1. Evaluating Location Potential: Explores the significance of choosing an ideal location with high demand and growth potential.

    1. Understanding Financials: Provides insights into initial investment costs, ongoing fees, and projected ROI to make informed financial decisions.

    1. Training and Support: Outlines the importance of comprehensive training programs and ongoing support from the franchisor.

Requirements To Open Coworking Franchise

If you’re an aspiring entrepreneur looking to dive into the world of coworking spaces, opening a coworking franchise can be an exciting and lucrative opportunity.

However, before you embark on this venture, it’s crucial to understand the essential requirements that come with it. First and foremost, you must have a deep passion for fostering a collaborative and innovative community, as coworking spaces thrive on fostering connections among diverse professionals.

Understanding the local market demand and selecting the right location is equally vital – a bustling urban area or a burgeoning business district can significantly impact the success of your franchise.

Additionally, ensure you have a well-defined business plan, covering financial projections, marketing strategies, and operational procedures.

Of course, securing sufficient capital is crucial to kickstart your franchise, so having a solid financial plan and access to funding sources is essential.

Lastly, choosing the right coworking brand with a proven track record and strong support system can provide a solid foundation for your franchise’s growth and success. By fulfilling these requirements, you’ll be better prepared to make your mark in the coworking industry and create a thriving and welcoming space for professionals in your community.

Seize the Opportunity – Invest in a Coworking Franchise Today

In conclusion, investing in a coworking franchise presents a unique and lucrative opportunity for entrepreneurs and business-minded individuals. The rise of remote work and the increasing demand for flexible office spaces have created a thriving market for coworking spaces.

By investing in a coworking franchise, you can tap into this growing trend and capitalize on the changing landscape of work. With a proven business model, established brand recognition, and ongoing support from the franchisor, you can mitigate many of the risks associated with starting a new venture.

Moreover, coworking spaces offer numerous benefits to both freelancers and small businesses. They provide a professional environment, access to amenities, networking opportunities, and a sense of community that traditional offices may lack. As more professionals seek flexible work arrangements, the demand for coworking spaces is expected to continue rising.

By investing in a coworking franchise today, you position yourself at the forefront of this industry’s growth. You have the chance to create an innovative workspace that meets the evolving needs of modern professionals while generating substantial returns on your investment.

Don’t miss out on this opportunity. Take the leap into entrepreneurship by investing in a coworking franchise today and reap the rewards of being part of this dynamic industry. Seize this chance to build your own successful business while providing valuable services to professionals needing flexible workspace solutions.

 

FAQ’s

  • 1. Is coworking business profitable?

    Yes, a coworking business can be profitable if it is well-planned and executed effectively. The profitability of a coworking business depends on several factors, such as location, pricing strategy, target market, operating costs, and the overall demand for flexible workspace solutions in the area.

  • 2. How do i start coworking office?

    Starting a coworking office requires careful planning and execution. Here are the essential steps to guide you through the process:

    1. Market Research: Begin by conducting thorough market research to identify the demand for coworking spaces in your chosen location. Analyze the target audience, competition, and potential growth opportunities.

    2. Business Plan: Develop a comprehensive business plan that outlines your objectives, target market, pricing strategy, marketing approach, financial projections, and operational details. A well-structured business plan will help you stay focused and attract potential investors or lenders.

    3. Location: Choose a strategic and accessible location that aligns with your target market. Opt for areas with a high concentration of professionals, startups, and businesses, or close to transportation hubs for convenience.

    4. Space Design: Design a functional and aesthetically appealing workspace that fosters creativity, productivity, and collaboration. Consider flexible layouts, comfortable furniture, meeting rooms, and essential amenities like high-speed internet and refreshment areas.

    5. Legal and Regulatory Compliance: Register your business and ensure you comply with all local laws, regulations, and licensing requirements for running a coworking space.

    6. Financing: Determine the initial investment required to start the coworking office. Secure financing through personal savings, bank loans, or investors.

  • 3. How does coworking make money?

    Coworking spaces employ several revenue streams to generate income and sustain their operations. Here are some ways in which coworking spaces make money:

    1. Membership Fees: The primary source of revenue for coworking spaces is membership fees. They offer various membership plans, such as daily passes, part-time memberships, hot desks, dedicated desks, and private offices, each with different pricing tiers based on usage and amenities.

    2. Private Office Rentals: Coworking spaces often provide private office spaces with additional services and amenities. These private offices are offered at premium rates and cater to businesses or individuals seeking a more exclusive and enclosed workspace.

    3. Meeting Room Rentals: Coworking spaces typically have well-equipped meeting rooms that members can rent for client meetings, workshops, seminars, or other events. These rentals contribute to additional revenue.

    4. Virtual Office Services: Some coworking spaces offer virtual office services, which include a business address, mail handling, and call forwarding. These services attract remote businesses or entrepreneurs seeking a professional address without the need for physical office space.

    5. Event Space Rentals: Coworking spaces often have event spaces that can be rented out for networking events, product launches, or corporate gatherings. These events generate revenue and increase the visibility of the coworking space.

    6. Additional Services: Coworking spaces may offer extra services like printing and scanning facilities, high-speed internet access, storage lockers, and catering services. These add-ons provide convenience to members and create additional revenue streams.

    7. Partnerships and Sponsorships: Coworking spaces can partner with local businesses or service providers to offer exclusive deals to their members. In return, these partnerships may lead to commissions or sponsorships, benefiting both parties.

    8. Corporate Memberships: Some coworking spaces offer corporate membership packages tailored to businesses with multiple employees. Corporate memberships often come with additional benefits and discounts, making them an attractive option for companies.

    9. Affiliate Programs: Coworking spaces can join affiliate programs with various service providers, such as software companies or office supply vendors. When their members purchase products or services through these partnerships, the coworking space earns a commission.

    10. Workshops and Events: Coworking spaces may organize workshops, training sessions, or educational events. These events not only add value to the community but also generate revenue through ticket sales or additional fees.

    By combining these revenue streams and maintaining a vibrant and supportive community, coworking spaces can achieve financial sustainability and continue to provide valuable services to their members.

  • 4. How do i start a coworking office?

    Starting a coworking office can be a rewarding venture if done right. Follow these steps to kickstart your coworking journey:

    1. Market Research: Research the demand for coworking spaces in your area, understand your target audience, and identify your competition.

    2. Business Plan: Create a detailed business plan outlining your goals, target market, pricing strategy, financial projections, and operational framework.

    3. Location: Choose a strategic location near business hubs or transportation centers to attract potential members.

    4. Space Design: Design a flexible and inviting workspace that fosters collaboration and productivity.

    5. Legal Compliance: Ensure you comply with all legal and regulatory requirements for running a coworking office.

    6. Financing: Secure funding through personal savings, loans, or investors.

    7. Membership Plans: Offer diverse membership options to cater to various needs and budgets.

    8. Marketing: Develop a strong brand identity and use effective marketing strategies to promote your coworking office.

    9. Community Building: Foster a supportive community by organizing networking events and workshops.

    10. Operations: Implement efficient management systems to handle memberships and facility maintenance.

    For expert guidance and solutions to make your coworking dream a reality, contact Propques today!

    Ready to launch your coworking office and create an inspiring workspace for professionals? Contact Propques now for expert assistance and turn your vision into a successful reality. Get started today!

The post How to Obtain a Coworking Franchise in India appeared first on Propques.

item.title: Top 5 Predictions for Coworking Trends in 2021
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents The year 2020, was full of chaos and uncertainty. Growth rates of many industries were slowed by the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Coworking industry has suffered the same fate. According to a report by Business Wire -“ The global coworking spaces market is expected to decline from $9.27 billion in …

Top 5 Predictions for Coworking Trends in 2021 Read More »

The post Top 5 Predictions for Coworking Trends in 2021 appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

The year 2020, was full of chaos and uncertainty. Growth rates of many industries were slowed by the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Coworking industry has suffered the same fate. According to a report by Business Wire -“ The global coworking spaces market is expected to decline from $9.27 billion in 2019 and to $8.24 billion in 2020 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of -12.9%. The decline is mainly due to economic slowdown across countries owing to the COVID-19 outbreak and the measures to contain it. The market is then expected to recover and reach $11.52 billion in 2023 at CAGR of 11.8%.” For the coworking market to recover, we expect to see some major new trends that will take the coworking industry by storm this year.

That said, in this article, we’ve listed out the Top 5 Coworking trends in the year 2021.

Focus on resources and amenities concerning health and hygiene.

Coworking service providers will focus
more on safe and hygienic workplace environments. There will be a rise in
covid-19 compliant workspaces.

Services like: Air purifiers, Thermal scanning, Hourly sanitization, etc will be a must.

Moreover, Companies like Safeworkspaze have partnered with many coworking providers to deliver the services mentioned above.

Large enterprises will move their workforce to Coworking spaces

The year 2020 will always be remembered
to be the year when the Corona-virus hit the world. One other thing it will be
remembered for is how it’s been a real game-changer for businesses in
redefining and reshaping the way people work.

Large companies are actively implementing
the Work From Home model or similar hybrid models. This will, in turn, increase
demand for coworking spaces as companies will try to leverage the advantages of
flexible space-as-a-service and office decentralization.

Increase in requests for private offices compared to individual seats

In 2021, we will see a rise in demand for private office space compared to individual seats. Coworking Resources observed a 76% higher share of requests for private offices compared to individual seats after analyzing over 3,000 requests between February 2020  (pre-lockdowns) and May 2020 (post-lockdowns). With new strands of the virus emerging from all around the globe, requests for private offices are only expected to increase.

Virtualization of coworking spaces

One unique trend that we will see this year is virtual coworking spaces. Virtual coworking spaces provide many of the same benefits as a physical coworking space with more affordable prices. Instead of physically going to the location, you will have to log in to your coworking portal. The main benefits of virtualization will be the ability to socialize and network with like-minded people from all around the globe.

Increase in Coworking spaces in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities.

According to an article by Times of India, before the pandemic, the top seven cities accounted for almost 70% of India’s residential population. This figure is most likely to change as more and more people are moving to their home cities due to the work from home culture. This trend will increase the demand for coworking spaces in tier-2 and tier-3 cities. To tackle this problem, We work is planning to introduce a new WFNH (Work from Near Home) model in which it will open coworking spaces within cycling distance from peoples homes, making the coworking space more accessible and available.

The Bottom Line

The pandemic might have caused some hiccups for the coworking industry but with large enterprises turning towards coworking providers to fill in the gap between WFH models and traditional workspaces, the demand for coworking space will only increase.

The post Top 5 Predictions for Coworking Trends in 2021 appeared first on Propques.

item.title: COVID lockdown is like a meditation spree for the flexible office industry, Insightful and Refreshing!
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
What meditations do for us? It relaxes our senses, gives us the time to think around and focus on our future goals. We can consider this pandemic time the same for our co-working enterprises, as it has given us the time to review our strategies and decisions. We can evaluate the steps we took for …

COVID lockdown is like a meditation spree for the flexible office industry, Insightful and Refreshing! Read More »

The post COVID lockdown is like a meditation spree for the flexible office industry, Insightful and Refreshing! appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
What meditations do for us? It relaxes our senses, gives us the time to think around and focus on our future goals. We can consider this pandemic time the same for our co-working enterprises, as it has given us the time to review our strategies and decisions. We can evaluate the steps we took for our business in the past. And also can formulate a policy that we can follow to overcome the current downfall.
For soon, things are going to come back to normal, obviously with bit twisted demands.

So, co-working operators and property owners must re-think their plans and mould them according to the changing requirements. Because, without a well-thought-of plan of action, it would be tough to survive high competition after the COVID. Utilize this pandemic time to plan out strategies in advance with co-working consultants. For when COVID is gone, you must not waste a single day to escalate your revenues. Expert findings and forecasts have given a ray of hope to co-working operators and property owners. Seeing the industry trends and steps taken by major corporate, assumptions are office work will take a shift towards flexible spaces and serviced offices from traditional ones.

Multiple reasons are behind this trend of choosing flexible offices

  • First, they are suitable to changing requirements and needs like reduction in staff, modern design, premium location, etc.

  • Secondly, they don’t bring the burden of multiple fixed operating expenses; this saves time, money, and effort.

  • Third, employees are also quite happier and satisfied with the flexible office concept. And, there are many other reasons too but, that will need a separate discussion.

Bring your best minds together to chalk out a strategy that can help you to overcome the losses. Take the support of experienced co-working consultancies to discuss new strategies and plans to make the best use of the after COVID period. As more flexible offices will pour in eyeing the increased demands, also existing operators will put their best foot forward to establish and expand themselves. The need will be to employ new marketing and sales strategies to handle the competition to steer ahead.

Bottom Line

Although this period is a setback for every industry, the coming days promise a much better and prosperous future for the co-workings. Think of this time as ‘Time Out period of 20-20 matches,’ where you can work out team strategy, assess the match played till then, and formulate new policies for future challenges.

The post COVID lockdown is like a meditation spree for the flexible office industry, Insightful and Refreshing! appeared first on Propques.

item.title: Is Coworking Space Taking Over Commercial Real Estate
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Table of Contents While coworking is not new (Regus dates back to 1989), the modern concept originated on the West Coast in the mid-2000s, with a focus on community, collaboration and interaction. Traditional offices have recently been superseded by coworking spaces which have proliferated all over the world. Because their core idea is based on …

Is Coworking Space Taking Over Commercial Real Estate Read More »

The post Is Coworking Space Taking Over Commercial Real Estate appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

While coworking is not new (Regus dates back to 1989), the modern concept originated on the West Coast in the mid-2000s, with a focus on community, collaboration and interaction.

Traditional offices have recently been superseded by coworking spaces which have proliferated all over the world. Because their core idea is based on the creation of a thriving community and fostering networking, such offices are becoming more and more popular among millennials and, thus profitable for their owners. Not only is it a great choice for small and growing businesses but also the concept of shared spaces is chosen by big corporations. The latter often set up innovation labs within the walls of shared space venues.

How Coworking Influences Commercial Real Estate:

1. Facilities Management

Coworking means sharing. But it does not just stop at sharing the workspace. Costs associated with electricity, security, the Internet, etc. are divided between all of the tenants of a coworking space. This works beneficially for all parties involved.

Compared to renting a regular office, a coworking space offers a cheaper alternative to traditional offices for freelancers and companies. At the same time, business operators overall earn more on facilities management service despite charging a low cost per client.

2. Smart Building Technology

A lot of coworking spaces apply smart technologies when designing and building a venue. A lot of processes are becoming automated from visitor management and heating to cloud access control and cutting-edge security. This makes coworking spaces not only more attractive to professionals but also sustainable and forward-thinking.

3. Brokerage‍

Coworking space agreements are usually less complicated than the traditional ones. They are flexible and allow short-time leasing. There is a possibility to rent a working space even on an hourly basis. This is a definite advantage for fast-growing businesses. As they develop, they make use of the scalability offered by coworking spaces.

Brokers might become less influential in the future, as the relationship between a space provider and a client will be a direct one. Brokerage might shift towards advising, as it is expected that there will be a reduced number of long-term leasing agreements.

4. Understanding of Workplace

A workplace of the future is more than an office. It can offer a working space, a communal area, a coffee shop, a kindergarten, and a gym. It is flexible, it is attractive, and it boosts creativity. And that’s what the generation of millennials needs. They are not bound by the 9 to 5 rules. They value money and the freedom it gives, and they cherish when work and leisure can be combined.

5. Project Management

Because coworking venues are pre-furnished, well-maintained and have all the facilities included in the price, companies should not worry about spending a fortune on fit-outs and improvements which they otherwise would have to go through in case of leasing a traditional office.

What will it be in the future?

At present, traditional real estate owners have started to adopt some of the best things about coworking—better employee work experiences, shared resources, a wide range of workplaces, and happy working hours.

While the commercial landlord has already seen many changes, there is still more to come.

More space redevelopment.

With commercial real estate showing no sign of slowing down and with a growing demand for coworking space from the advent of freelancing, coworking, and hybrids, more real estate developers and coworking operators are extending their ventures to secondary and tertiary markets in anticipation of gaining more profit.

About Propques

Our coworking consultancy services include tailor-made programs and strategies to help you get started, optimize your coworking space business, and ensure to thrive. We help you get the most out of your coworking space business, and also provide the necessary information needed to fast track your vision. Our team helps build effective coworking space pricing model that boost ROI’s and open doors to long-term success.

We even assist landlords in making the most out of their under-utilized spaces. Our Space-as-a-Service strategy can help you generate upwards of 3 times the revenue of a standalone space. Our team of experts has a proven track record of creating unique strategies that will help you maximize the opportunity and returns.

The post Is Coworking Space Taking Over Commercial Real Estate appeared first on Propques.

item.title: These Facts will force you to #StartYourOwnCoWorking
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
‘Flex seat enquiries up 17% Y-o-Y in Tier II cities’ Start-ups, SMEs and companies in the fintech and e-commerce segments focusing on emerging economic centres and smaller towns for business growth and enterprises looking to tap into the talent pool of an increasingly mobile workforce are the mainstays of this rise in enquiries for flex …

These Facts will force you to #StartYourOwnCoWorking Read More »

The post These Facts will force you to #StartYourOwnCoWorking appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
‘Flex seat enquiries up 17% Y-o-Y in Tier II cities’


Start-ups, SMEs and companies in the fintech and e-commerce segments focusing on emerging economic centres and smaller towns for business growth and enterprises looking to tap into the talent pool of an increasingly mobile workforce are the mainstays of this rise in enquiries for flex seats in Tier II cities as per the report.
Chandigarh, Indore and Lucknow are seeing robust traction for flex enquiries. In fact, there is good traction across major Tier II cities in the North, West and South.
Source

The key factors driving the market growth are increasing work flexibility and remote work culture, growing freelancers’ population and increasing demand for shared office spaces. However, lack of awareness about coworking spaces among small businesses is restraining the market growth.
Source

Amid the Covid-19 pandemic, the demand for flex seats has been growing strongly. The total gross office space leasing across eight major cities stood at 52.6 million square feet, while the net office space leasing was 21 million square feet during the last year. The new supply of office space stood at 38 million square feet.
Source

A lot of small as well as large firms are popping up right now, and they are looking forward to co-working office spaces. With cheap internet access, technology is developing by huge strides, there is nothing permanent when it comes to workplace space. Most businesses are attempting to keep things more compact, rather than occupying a large leased area for a decade or more. Companies consider obtaining aesthetically pleasing co-working work spaces ideal for high-end client meetings. In India, there is an increasing need for Managed Work Spaces. This is another important reason why the number of flexible spaces in India is expected to double by 2025.
Source

Coworking operators sold over 55,000 seats in 2021, up from 36,000 seats in 2020, according to property experts, and they expect sales to double in 2022.
Source

In the last 18 months, the pandemic has not only redesigned the entire coworking ecosystem but has also encouraged real estate developers to join hands with coworking operators to create such special spaces.
Interested in short, crisp & relevant content on finger tips? | Download People Matters Sphere now! People matters SPHERE Google Play App Store
According to a Cushman & Wakefield report, coworking operators expanded their portfolio aggressively last year and took on lease 21 per cent more office area – 4.91 million square feet in 2021 from 4.05 million square feet in the previous year – across the top eight cities of Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Pune, Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, Chennai, Kolkata, Ahmedabad to meet the rising demand for flexible workspaces from corporates amid the pandemic.
Source

Demand for co-working office space jumped over two-fold in the last fiscal year at 90,200 desks across seven major cities as flexible workspaces rose in prominence after 2nd wave of the pandemic.
Source

There is a strong demand for co-working spaces and this has pushed co-working businesses to launch more centres in metropolises and other demand generating areas. Today, co-working spaces have become the most sought-after assets and their share in office leasing is anticipated to rise from a mere 2% in 2010 to 13% by 2024.
Source

Got a Question?

We are here to assist. Simply fill the form to help us understand your business, vision, and goals, so we can provide our exceptional services and suggestions to you.

“TURN YOUR VISION INTO A REALITY”

Please submit your inquiry via the form and you’ll hear back from us shortly.

+91-7392037856 | buzz@propques.com

The post These Facts will force you to #StartYourOwnCoWorking appeared first on Propques.

item.title: It’s time to make the shift from landlord to Coworking Operator
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
When you make the crucial shift from landlord to operator, your business experience will be more personal and rewarding. Here are some things to think about as you make this step: Coworking, shared office business models transform how we work and live because they can adapt to the needs of demand by offering flexibility and …

It’s time to make the shift from landlord to Coworking Operator Read More »

The post It’s time to make the shift from landlord to Coworking Operator appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
When you make the crucial shift from landlord to operator, your business experience will be more personal and rewarding. Here are some things to think about as you make this step:

Coworking, shared office business models transform how we work and live because they can adapt to the needs of demand by offering flexibility and access to a community.

Today we are more in need of spaces that offer us more than just the ability to work, and co-working spaces have become one of the tools to achieve this. As coworking operators start up in specific areas, it is not only about offering affordable office space but also about providing a wide variety of services for community members, including facilities for work, learning or play.

Besides property managers and owners, there are also those who take on the management of this type of business. They want to be close and have a direct relationship with the final user. For this reason, the value chain is becoming shorter and shorter: we find property owners that have become operators ( Summit space , Cubispace, workjar ) .

if you are a mere rent collector, have no strategy or generate no value, you are out of business. And to generate value, you need to know the end user well.

Agreements between the landlord and the operator

Coworking can be classified according to their management model. In other words, according to the contractual relationship between the owner and operator:

Owner as operator:

  • One of the owners also operates the coworking business.
  • He has 100% control over the business, profits and losses.
  • Here is where the risk lies. If you do not know this sector, it could be a mess. The less you know, the more risky your investment will be.

Lease agreement:

  • The owner leases the asset to a third party.
  • The rent can be fixed or variable (with a guaranteed minimum rent).
  • The owner has no control over the business and only deals with the real estate business.
  • In the case of renting with variable income, the owner participates indirectly in the good performance of the business.
  • The FF&E (Furniture, Fixtures & Equipment) by property owner and OS&E (Operating Supplies & Equipment) investment is assumed by the tenant.

Management fee agreement:

  • The owner hires an operator with extensive knowledge of the industry to manage the coworking operations.
  • The hired operator receives a management fee as compensation.
  • The entire business (asset + coworking operations) belongs to the owner.
  • The owner has no control over the business.
  • The entire construction investment is made by the owner.
  • The risk is assumed by the owner.

Propques management agreement:

  • The owner hires Propques as a consultant with extensive knowledge and experience in the sector to develop the entire project and manage the coworking operations under the owner’s brand.
  • Propques transfers the know-how to the owner: in the third year, the owner starts to manage the business with a trained and experimented team as well as being handed the Operations Manual of the business.
  • Propques receives a management fee as compensation.
  • The entire business (asset + coworking operations) belongs to the owner.
  • The owner has control of the business from the third year.
  • The entire construction investment is made by the owner.

If you are an owner who wants to operate under your own brand and control your business 100% by minimizing risks, contact us. We offer integral service for developing your coworking from conceptualization to business implementation until the 3rd year. We operate the space for you until you learn to manage it, and we share with you all the know-how so that you continue to be a successful operator.

The post It’s time to make the shift from landlord to Coworking Operator appeared first on Propques.

item.title: Coworking Trends you must know
item.dc:creator: Adarsh Dixit - Flexible Workspace Specialist
item.description:
Coworking is a trend that is on the rise, and for good reason. It has been shown to boost productivity, creativity, and collaboration among its members. And as the workforce continues to evolve, coworking will become even more popular. If you’re not familiar with coworking, it’s time to get up to speed. In this blog …

Coworking Trends you must know Read More »

The post Coworking Trends you must know appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Coworking is a trend that is on the rise, and for good reason. It has been shown to boost productivity, creativity, and collaboration among its members. And as the workforce continues to evolve, coworking will become even more popular. If you’re not familiar with coworking, it’s time to get up to speed. In this blog post, we will explore the top coworking trends you need to know. From the rise of remote workers to the popularity of flex spaces, read on to learn more about this growing trend.

Rise of Coworking Trend Spaces

The rise of coworking has been one of the most talked about trends in recent years. And it’s no wonder why.

Coworking spaces provide a flexible, affordable, and convenient way to work, whether you’re a freelancer, small business owner or startup founder. And with the rise of the gig economy and more people working remotely, coworking spaces have become even more popular.

This growth is being driven by a number of factors, including the increasing popularity of coworking, the rise of the gig economy and the need for more flexible working arrangements.

So what is driving this trend? Let’s take a look at some of the key factors:

The Gig Economy: The rise of the gig economy has been a major factor in the growth of coworking spaces. With more people working freelance or contract jobs, there’s a need for flexible, affordable workspace solutions that can be accessed on demand. Coworking spaces provide the perfect solution for these workers, who often don’t have access to traditional office space.

The Need for Flexibility: Another factor driving the growth of coworking is the need for more flexible working arrangements. With advances in technology making it easier to work remotely, more people are looking for alternatives to traditional offices. Coworking spaces provide a flexible and convenient way to work, without being tied

2022 Best Coworking Trends

Coworking is no longer a new concept. In fact, it’s been around for over a decade now. And in that time, it’s undergone quite a few changes.

So what can we expect from coworking in 2022? Here are some of the best coworking trends to keep an eye out for:

1. Virtual Offices

With more and more people working remotely, the demand for virtual offices is on the rise. A virtual office is a type of coworking space that allows members to work from anywhere in the world, using a variety of online tools and services.

2. Flexible Workspaces

Flexible workspace is another trend on the rise in recent years. This type of workspace gives employees the ability to choose when and where they want to work. This could mean working from home two days a week and coming into the office for the other three days, or it could mean working from different coworking spaces throughout the week.

3. Coworking Cafes

Coworking cafes are popping up all over the world as people look for more social and relaxed coworking environments. These cafes offer a place to work, along with food and drink options, making them ideal for those who want to take a break from their usual office or home setup.

4. Collaborative Workspaces

Collaborative workspace is another growing trend in the coworking world

Coworking Advantages

There are plenty of advantages that come with coworking, which is why the trend has been on the rise in recent years. For starters, it can help to increase productivity and creativity thanks to the collaboration and sense of community that coworking spaces provide. Additionally, it can be a more cost-effective way to work since you won’t have to pay for your own office space or equipment. And last but not least, it can offer a better work/life balance since you’ll have the flexibility to choose your own hours and work from anywhere.

What is a Coworking Space?

A coworking space is a shared office environment where individuals from different companies or organizations can come together to work. It’s a flexible way to get office space without the need for a long-term lease or the hassle of setting up your own office.

Coworking spaces typically provide desks, chairs, and other basic office furniture, as well as Wi-Fi and printer access. Some also offer additional amenities like coffee and snack bars, conference rooms, and on-site childcare. Prices vary depending on the location and amenities offered, but they are often much cheaper than renting your own office space.

The coworking trend has been growing in popularity in recent years as more people work remotely or freelance. Coworking spaces provide a sense of community and collaboration that many remote workers crave. And since most spaces offer flexible membership options, it’s easy to try out coworking without making a long-term commitment.

How to start a coworking Space business

If you’re thinking about starting a coworking space business, there are a few things you should know about the current trends in the industry. First, the demand for coworking spaces is growing rapidly. Many of the largest coworking space operators are now expanding into new markets and offering additional services such as private offices, meeting rooms, and event space.

If you’re interested in starting your own coworking space business, we’ve put together a few tips to help you get started:

1. Do your research: The first step is to understand the demand for coworking spaces in your area and what kind of prices people are willing to pay. You can do this by searching online for coworking spaces in your city or town and seeing how many results come up. You can also check out websites like DeskSurfing and WeWork Labs to get an idea of the average prices charged by similar businesses.

2. Create a business plan: Once you have an idea of the demand and pricing for coworking spaces in your area, you’ll need to create a detailed business plan that outlines how you intend to start and operate your business.

If you want more information to start your own coworking space and control your business 100% by minimizing risks, contact us. We offer integral service for developing your coworking project from conceptualization to business implementation until the 3rd or 5th year. We operate the space for you until you learn to manage it, and we share with you all the know-how so that you continue to be a successful operator.

The post Coworking Trends you must know appeared first on Propques.

Ahmedabad is the city of Gujarat Situated 30 KM Away from the Capital city Gandhi Nagar. It is the corporate hub of Gujarat State. The city is home to a large number of businesses and corporate headquarters. Ahmedabad is a major center for businesses and startups. The city has a thriving business community and is …

CoWorking Space in Ahmedabad Read More »

The post CoWorking Space in Ahmedabad appeared first on Propques.
item.content:encoded:
Ahmedabad is the city of Gujarat Situated 30 KM Away from the Capital city Gandhi Nagar. It is the corporate hub of Gujarat State. The city is home to a large number of businesses and corporate headquarters. Ahmedabad is a major center for businesses and startups. The city has a thriving business community and is a major driver of the state’s economy.

Ahmedabad is a major center for trade and commerce. The city is also home to a number of educational institutions and is a major center for research and development.

There are plenty of opportunities for coworking spaces. In fact, many coworking spaces have found the city to be suitable for their business.
If you’re looking for a good coworking space in Ahmedabad, we’ve got you covered. Here are a few of our top picks:

  1. Incuspaze: Enterprise managed spaces and Coworking
  2. The Address: Premium Coworking Space, Shared and Managed Office
  3. Regus | Serviced Office Space, Coworking & Virtual Offices
  4. Connekt
  5. Uncubate CoWorking Space
  6. Opulence: On-demand Vivid Coworking Space | Shared Office
  7. Büro – Work. Network. Thrive. Coworking Spaces
  8. BSQUARE Coworking Space
  9. Open Turf Coworking

Incuspaze

Incuspaze is a trusted network of coworking spaces and managed office spaces for startups, enterprises, and MSEs across India. We are currently present in over 30+ locations in 10 cities, with a vision to offer flexible workspaces that are thoroughly professional and thoughtfully designed. At Incuspaze, we believe in delivering the best workplace experience to our customers. We are dedicated to supporting businesses of all kinds and providing them with the workspace they need to succeed.

Locations in Ahmedabad : 5
Goolge Ratings: 4.5

The Address

The Address Provides an optimal coworking experience without having to break the bank. They believe in making sure their clients have access to everything they need to work as efficiently as possible. They believe that size should be a determining factor in whether or not a company can have a base in a flexible workspace – that’s why they have various pricing plans that can accommodate enterprises both big and small. Whatever your budget may be, The Address has the perfect solution for you.

Locations in Ahmedabad : 4
Google Ratings : 4.7

Regus

Regus is the world’s largest provider of flexible workspace solutions. They have an extensive network of over 3,000 locations in over 900 cities across 120 countries. Their customers include some of the most successful entrepreneurs, individuals and multi-million dollar corporations. Regus provides modern, flexible workspace solutions that allow their customers to focus on their business goals and objectives. Their solutions are designed to meet the specific needs of each customer and can be customized to fit any budget.

Locations In Ahmedabad : 3
Google Ratings : 4.2

Connekt

Connekt coworking has been designed with ergonomics in mind to boost efficiency and productivity throughout the work day. Their amenities and facilities include high-speed wifi, conference rooms, meeting rooms, informal meeting rooms, event spaces, round-the-clock coffee and tea, CCTV cameras and fingerprint security, printer, scanner and photocopy services, latest technological equipment, an in house cafe and more!

Locations In Ahmedabad : 2
Google Ratings : 4.4

Uncubate

Uncubate provides dedicated desks and Flexi desks based on the requirement, promoting an open space environment where coworkers can interact with each other. It is one of the most sought-after shared offices in Ahmedabad.

Locations In Ahmedabad : 2
Google Ratings : 4.5

Opulence

Opulence co-working space in Ahmedabad is situated in a strategic location that is safe and secure. The proximity to BRTS station and ease of travelling to S.G Highway and C.G road makes it an attractive option for those who want to take advantage of it’s services.

Locations In Ahmedabad : 2
Google Ratings : 4.7

Büro

If you’re looking for an on-demand coworking workspace, a dedicated desk, or an exclusive premium cabin, Büro has you covered. With a virtual office, you can have all the benefits of a physical office without renting any space. Büro is your one-stop shop for all your office needs in Ahmedabad.

Locations In Ahmedabad : 2
Google Ratings : 4.8

BSQUARE

BSQUARE is a top-notch coworking space in Ahmedabad, Gujarat that offers versatile and well-equipped coworking spaces for entrepreneurs, MNCs, startups, big, medium and small companies, freelancers and collaborators. Our state-of-the-art coworking facilities include flexible offices, managed workspaces, coworking stations and office spaces that are designed to promote productivity and creativity. If you’re looking for a stylish and professional environment to grow your business, BSQUARE is the perfect place for you.

Locations In Ahmedabad : 2
Google Ratings : 4.8

Open Turf

Open Turf CoWorking Space is supporting individuals and teams who have the same vision and drive to grow and learn from one another. They strive to create an ideal interactive platform that can benefit all types of organizations, especially those who are passionate about making a difference.

Locations In Ahmedabad : 2
Google Ratings : 5.0

We hope this list helps you find the perfect place to get your work done in Ahmedabad!

If you want more information to start your own coworking space and control your business 100% by minimizing risks, contact us. We offer integral service for developing your coworking project from conceptualization to business implementation until the 3rd or 5th year. We operate the space for you until you learn to manage it, and we share with you all the know-how so that you continue to be a successful operator.

The post CoWorking Space in Ahmedabad appeared first on Propques.

item.content:encoded:

Indore’s increasing population and corresponding infrastructure development have led to significant economic growth and new business prospects.

Businesses of all sizes, from small to large enterprises, are contributing to the development of opportunities in Indore.
